'''Jóhann Berg Guðmundsson''' (born 27 October 1990) is an Icelandic professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Left winger|winger]] for {{English football updater|Burnley}} club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] and the [[Iceland national football team|Iceland national team]].
Jóhann began his senior career at [[Breiðablik UBK|Breiðablik]] for a single season before moving to Dutch team [[AZ Alkmaar]] in the [[Eredivisie]] where they also participated in the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]]. After a few seasons with them, he joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] for two seasons, then to newly promoted club Burnley where he featured for most of the [[2017–18 Burnley F.C. season|2017–18 season]] in qualifying for the Europa League.
Jóhann was part of the Iceland national team in both the [[UEFA Euro 2016]] and [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], the former competition saw him assisting Iceland's first ever goal in a major tournament.
==Club career== ===Breiðablik 2008–09=== Born in [[Reykjavík]], Jóhann started his career at [[Breiðablik UBK|Breiðablik]], but moved to England early in his career when his parent decided to relocate there. He had spells with the youth team at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], while studying at the International School of London. After failing to adapt to life in London, he decided to move back to Iceland in 2008, joining his boyhood club [[Breiðablik UBK|Breiðablik]] as he admitted missing playing football and attending school with his friends.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fotbolti.net/fullStory.php?id=61651|title=Jóhann Berg: Frá Chelsea og Fulham í byrjunarlið Breiðabliks|website=Fotbolti.net|language=Icelandic|date=20 May 2008|accessdate=19 July 2016}}</ref>
After returning to Breiðablik, Jóhann made his senior debut in the opening match of the season, where he played 72 minutes, in a 1–1 draw against [[Íþróttabandalag Akraness]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Leystum sterka vörn ÍA ágætlega|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/efstadeild/2008/05/10/leystum_sterka_vorn_ia_agaetlega/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=10 May 2008|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> He established himself as first team regular in the [[2008 Úrvalsdeild]], where he played often as left wing and striker,<ref name="GuðmundssonMBL.is">{{cite news|title=Jóhann Berg fremstur jafningja|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/efstadeild/2008/08/11/johann_berg_fremstur_jafningja/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=11 August 2008|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and scored his first Breiðablik goal on 7 July 2008, in a 2–0 win over [[Fylkir]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Blikar unnu þreytulega Fylkismenn|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/efstadeild/2008/07/07/blikar_unnu_threytulega_fylkismenn/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=7 July 2008|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann finished the season with 22 appearances, six goals, and was voted best player for the second third of the Icelandic Premier League season.<ref name="GuðmundssonMBL.is" />
===AZ Alkmaar 2009–14=== [[File:Johann-berg-gudmondsson-1313350875.jpg|thumb|left|Jóhann at AZ]]
After an earlier bid from [[Hamburger SV]] fell through, Jóhann transferred to Dutch club [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]] on 28 January 2009, signing a 5-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://breidablik.is/frett.php?id_frett%3D4844%26b%3D1 |title=Jóhann Berg til AZ Alkmaar|accessdate=28 January 2009 |deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722020902/http://breidablik.is/frett.php?id_frett=4844&b=1 |archivedate=22 July 2011 }}</ref>
Having spent two seasons at the club's reserve, Jóhann was given a first team chance under the new management of [[Gertjan Verbeek]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Kolbeinn og Jóhann Berg fá nýjan þjálfara|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2010/04/22/kolbeinn_og_johann_berg_fa_nyjan_thjalfara/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=22 April 2010|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann scored on his AZ debut in the first round of Europa League Qualifiers, in a 2–0 win over [[IFK Göteborg]] in the first leg and went on to go through to next round despite losing 1–0 in the second leg.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann Berg og Rúrik skoruðu í Evrópudeildinni|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2010/07/29/johann_berg_og_rurik_skorudu_i_evropudeildinni/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=29 July 2010|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann then made his league debut for the club, playing in the opening match of the season, in a 1–1 draw against [[NAC Breda]].<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ start met gelijkspel in Breda|url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-start-met-gelijkspel-in-breda/1|publisher=AZ Official Website|language=Dutch|date=8 August 2010|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann scored again in the Matchday One of the Europa League Group stage, in a 2–1 win over [[FC Sheriff Tiraspol|Sheriff Tiraspol]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann skoraði í sigurleik í Evrópudeildinni|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2010/09/16/johann_skoradi_i_sigurleik_i_evropudeildinni/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=16 September 2010|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and scored again in the third round of [[2010–11 KNVB Cup|KNVB Cup]], in 3 –2 win over [[FC Den Bosch|Den Bosch]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann Berg skoraði fyrir AZ Alkmaar|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2010/09/22/johann_berg_skoradi_fyrir_az_alkmaar/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=22 September 2010|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann then scored his first AZ league goal on 29 January 2011, in a 6–1 win against [[VVV-Venlo]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Sigthorsson leidt AZ naar ruime zege op VVV|url=http://www.ad.nl/sport/sigthorsson-leidt-az-naar-ruime-zege-op-vvv~afb751e9/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=29 January 2011|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann later finished the 2010–11 season, making thirty–four appearance and scoring four times in all competitions.
In the 2011–12 season, Jóhann started the season well when he scored in the first round of Europa League Qualifiers, in a 2–0 win over [[FK Jablonec|Jablonec]] and went on to go through to next round after a 1–1 draw.<ref name=JBisAZ>{{cite news|title=Jóhann Berg innsiglaði sigur AZ|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2011/07/28/johann_berg_innsigladi_sigur_az/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=28 July 2011|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> 30 days later, on 28 August 2011, Jóhann scored his first league goal of the season, in a 3–0 win over [[FC Groningen|Groningen]]<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ kinderlijk eenvoudig langs FC Groningen|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/az-kinderlijk-eenvoudig-langs-groningen~a4ae267b/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=28 August 2011|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and scored against them once again on 22 September 2011, in a 4–2 in the second round of [[2011–12 KNVB Cup|KNVB Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann Berg innsiglaði sigur AZ|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2011/09/22/johann_berg_innsigladi_sigur_az/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=22 September 2011|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Then on 25 November 2011, Jóhann scored his second league goal, in a 2–0 win over [[FC Utrecht|Utrecht]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Swingend AZ zet ook FC Utrecht opzij|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/swingend-az-zet-ook-fc-utrecht-opzij~aacc022c/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=25 November 2011|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> On 6 January 2012, Jóhann signed a contract extension with the club, keeping him until 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gudmundsson langer bij AZ|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/telesport/voetbal/az/20096756/__AZ_strikt_Gudmundsson__.html|work=De Telegraaf|language=Dutch|date=6 January 2012|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann went on to score two more goals towards the end of the 2011–12 season against [[Heracles Almelo]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Heracles voor het eerst in 109 jaar naar finale|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/heracles-voor-het-eerst-in-109-jaar-naar-finale~aea99c78/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=22 March 2012|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and [[RKC Waalwijk]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Koploper AZ worstelt zich langs RKC|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/koploper-az-worstelt-zich-langs-rkc~a446507a/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=25 March 2012|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann finished the 2011–12 season, making 47 appearance and scoring six times in all competitions.
In the 2012–13 season, Jóhann remained in the starting line–up until he received a straight red card in the 82nd minutes, in a 0–0 draw against [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]] on 26 August 2012 and had to serve a two match suspension as a result.<ref>{{cite news|title=KNVB schorst Gudmundsson twee duels|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/telesport/voetbal/az/20961596/__Twee_duels_voor_Gudmundsson__.html|work=De Telegraaf|language=Dutch|date=27 August 2012|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> After serving a two match suspension, Jóhann then scored his first goal of the season on 28 October 2012, in a 2–1 win over [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]]<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ bezorgt Vitesse in eigen huis eerste nederlaag van seizoen|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/az-bezorgt-vitesse-in-eigen-huis-eerste-nederlaag-van-seizoen~a0af6f97/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=28 October 2012|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and scored a brace four days later in a 4–1 win over [[VV Sneek Wit Zwart|Sneek Wit Zwart]].<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ schrikt maar heel even in Friesland|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/az-schrikt-maar-heel-even-in-friesland~a71d5157/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=1 November 2012|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann's second league goal then came on 26 April 2013, as well as, setting up one of the goals, in a 4–0 win over Heerenveen.<ref>{{cite news|title=Heerenveen mist Kum tegen AZ|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/heerenveen-mist-kum-tegen-az~afcc657b/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=26 April 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann played a role in the KNVB Cup campaign when he scored two more goals against Den Bosch<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Den Bosch door fans en AZ te kijk gezet|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/fc-den-bosch-door-fans-en-az-te-kijk-gezet~a203762d/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=29 January 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]];<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann skoraði og AZ í bikarúrslitin|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2013/02/27/johann_skoradi_og_az_i_bikarurslitin/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=27 February 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and ultimately, helped them reach the [[2012–13 KNVB Cup#Final|final of KNVB Cup]], in a 2–1 win over [[PSV Eindhoven]], where he played 74 minutes before being substituted for [[Steven Berghuis]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann og Aron unnu bikarinn í Hollandi|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2013/05/09/johann_og_aron_unnu_bikarinn_i_hollandi/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=9 May 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann finished the 2012–13 season, making 39 appearance and scoring six times in all competitions.
In the 2013–14 season, Jóhann scored his first goal of the season and played 98 minutes after the match went to extra time, in a 3–2 loss against Ajax in the [[2013 Johan Cruyff Shield|Johan Cruyff Shield]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Ajax met Moisander en Krkic, AZ met Wuytens en Gudelj|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/ajax-met-moisander-en-krkic-az-met-wuytens-en-gudelj~a3421341/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=27 July 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> By the end of 2013, Jóhann scored seven goals in the Europa League and league combined against [[Atromitos F.C.|Atromitos]] (twice),<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ op rozen na IJslandse goals in Athene|url=http://www.ad.nl/buitenlands-voetbal/az-op-rozen-na-ijslandse-goals-in-athene~a4f64aca/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=22 August 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Sigurmark Jóhanns og sigur hjá Tottenham Hotspur|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/enski/2013/09/19/sigurmark_johanns_og_sigur_hja_tottenham/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=19 September 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Groningen,<ref>{{cite news|title=Zivkovic schenkt Groningen zege met eerste balcontact|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/zivkovic-schenkt-groningen-zege-met-eerste-balcontact~ab7cb3f6/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=6 October 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> [[FC Shakhter Karagandy|Shakhter Karagandy]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Bibberend AZ blijft met moeite overeind in Siberisch Astana|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/bibberend-az-blijft-met-moeite-overeind-in-siberisch-astana~a5b75a84/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=24 October 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> [[ADO Den Haag]]<ref>{{cite news|title=AZ nieuwe koploper in Eredivisie|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/az-nieuwe-koploper-in-eredivisie~a50c7fbe/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=2 November 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and Maccabi Haifa.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann tryggði sigur AZ í blálokin|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2013/11/28/johann_tryggdi_sigur_az_i_blalokin/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=28 November 2013|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> It wasn't until the match of the season when Jóhann scored his first goal of 2014, where he played 21 minutes, in a 1–1 draw against [[Feyenoord]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Pareltje van Gudmundsson zet AZ naast Feyenoord|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/pareltje-van-gudmundsson-zet-az-naast-feyenoord~adc64b46/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=3 May 2014|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> At the end of the 2013–14 season, Jóhann made 53 appearance and scoring nine goals in all competitions.
With his contract expiring at the end of the 2013–14 season, Jóhann announced his intention leave AZ.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gudmundsson vertrekt transfervrij bij AZ|url=http://www.ad.nl/eredivisie/gudmundsson-vertrekt-transfervrij-bij-az~a4d95a1f/|work=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=31 March 2014|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann explained his decision to leave AZ, citing new challenge by playing in England on a higher level.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gudmundsson wil naar Premier League|url=http://www.telegraaf.nl/telesport/voetbal/az/22452213/__AZ-aanvaller_wil_naar_Engeland__.html|work=De Telegraaf|language=Dutch|date=1 April 2014|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref>
===Charlton Athletic 2014–16=== [[File:Johann Berg Gudmundsson.png|thumb|right|Jóhann playing for [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]]]]
On 11 July 2014, Jóhann signed for [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] on a two-year deal after leaving AZ. The move also marked his return to England for the first time in eight years.<ref>{{cite web |title=Iceland winger Johann Berg Gudmundsson signs two-year deal |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20140711-johan-gudmundsson-signs-1744773.aspx |work=Charlton Athletic FC |date=11 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160818182020/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20140711-johan-gudmundsson-signs-1744773.aspx |archivedate=18 August 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Upon joining the club, Jóhann was given number seven shirt ahead of the new season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk//news/article/20140803-201415-squad-numbers-revealed-1801002.aspx |title=2014/15 squad numbers revealed |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=3 August 2014 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160527112720/http://www.cafc.co.uk//news/article/20140803-201415-squad-numbers-revealed-1801002.aspx |archivedate=27 May 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Jóhann made his Charlton Athletic debut, in the opening match of the season, in a 1–1 draw away to League new-boys [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Brentford 1–1 Charlton Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28646432|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 August 2014|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> He scored his first league goal for the club, in a 1–1 draw against [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on 20 September 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Rotherham United 1 – 1 Charlton Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29186763|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 September 2014|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> By November, Jóhann soon suffered from three injuries that kept him out on a short term.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20140916-preview-charlton-v-wolverhampton-wanderers-1918390.aspx |title=PREVIEW: Charlton Athletic v Wolverhampton Wanderers |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=16 September 2014 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160919153847/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20140916-preview-charlton-v-wolverhampton-wanderers-1918390.aspx |archivedate=19 September 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20140930-charlton-norwich-city-preview-1979187.aspx |title=PREVIEW: Charlton Athletic vs Norwich City |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=30 September 2014 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160919153740/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20140930-charlton-norwich-city-preview-1979187.aspx |archivedate=19 September 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20141020-bolton-preview-2028383.aspx |title=PREVIEW: Charlton Athletic vs Bolton Wanderers |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=20 October 2014 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160919153924/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/20141020-bolton-preview-2028383.aspx |archivedate=19 September 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> He then returned to the first team from injuries and soon scored his twice, in a 2–2 draw against [[Leeds United A.F.C.|Leeds United]] on 4 November 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leeds United 2 – 2 Charlton Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29797480|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 November 2014|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> He developed an eye for the spectacular after a host of impressive goals, most notably of which came against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on Boxing Day, in which he won Goal of the Season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Charlton Athletic 1 – 1 Cardiff City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30543573|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 December 2014|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/goal-of-the-season-gudmundsson-wins-competition-2461408.aspx |title=Johann Gudmundsson wins 2014/15 Goal of the Season |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=18 May 2015 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150519205514/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/goal-of-the-season-gudmundsson-wins-competition-2461408.aspx |archivedate=19 May 2015 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Jóhann went on to score six more goals for the club, as the 2014–15 season progressed, including against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]], resulting him earning March's goal of the month competition.<ref>{{cite news|title=Blackpool 0 – 3 Charlton Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31809694|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 March 2015|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-johann-berg-gudmundsson-free-kick-goal-of-the-month-winner-2404759.aspx |title=Gudmundsson wins March Goal of the Month |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=16 April 2015 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160919155318/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-johann-berg-gudmundsson-free-kick-goal-of-the-month-winner-2404759.aspx |archivedate=19 September 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Jóhann was voted runner-up in the club's player of the season competition after an impressive first campaign, which saw him net a total of 11 goals in 37 matches.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-player-of-the-year-2015-jordan-cousins-2438418.aspx |title=Jordan Cousins crowned 2014/15 Player of the Year |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=3 May 2015 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160919160038/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-player-of-the-year-2015-jordan-cousins-2438418.aspx |archivedate=19 September 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Ahead of the 2015–16 season, Jóhann signed a new four-year deal with the club on 22 July 2015.<ref>{{cite web |title=NEW DEAL Gudmundsson commits future to Charlton |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-johann-gudmundsson-new-four-year-deal-2562930.aspx |accessdate=22 July 2015 |date=22 July 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304001158/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-johann-gudmundsson-new-four-year-deal-2562930.aspx |archivedate=4 March 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> Jóhann then scored two goals in two matches between 22 August 2015 and 29 August 2015 against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Charlton Athletic 2 – 1 Hull City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33944301|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 August 2015|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2 – 1 Charlton Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34024948|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 August 2015|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann was soon on the sidelined for the remainder of December when he was limped off during a match against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-athletic-preview-burnley-2858362.aspx |title=PREVIEW – Charlton Athletic v Burnley |publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C. |date=18 December 2015 |accessdate=19 September 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160919160916/http://www.cafc.co.uk/news/article/charlton-athletic-preview-burnley-2858362.aspx |archivedate=19 September 2016 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> After making his return to the first team, Jóhann went on to score four more goals for the club, as the 2015–16 season progressed, against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Preston North End 2 – 1 Charlton Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35584417|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 February 2016|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> [[Birmingham F.C.|Birmingham City]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Charlton Athletic 2 – 1 Birmingham City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35902203|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 April 2016|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Charlton Athletic 1 – 3 Brighton Hove & Albion|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36060713|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 April 2016|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> and Leeds United.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leeds United 1 – 2 Charlton Athletic|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36118106|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 April 2016|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Though the club were relegated to [[Football League One|League One]], finishing 22nd place, Jóhann finished the 2015–16 season, making 42 appearances and scoring six times in all competitions. Nevertheless, Jóhann was joint–highest assist-maker in the Championship during the 2015–16 season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Burnley's new assist king Johann Berg Gudmundsson can't wait to start supplying 'great strikers'|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/14676149.Burnley_s_new_assist_king_Johann_Berg_Gudmundsson_can___t_wait_to_start_supplying____great_strikers___/|work=The Lancashire Telegraph|date=11 August 2016|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref>
===Burnley 2016–=== On 19 July 2016, Jóhann joined newly promoted [[Premier League]] team [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on a three-year deal for an undisclosed fee, alongside team–mate, [[Nick Pope (footballer)|Nick Pope]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Johann Berg Gudmundsson & Nick Pope: Burnley sign duo from Charlton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36835053|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 July 2016}}</ref> He made his Burnley debut, in the opening match of the season, coming on as a substitute for [[Scott Arfield]] in the 75th minute, in a 1–0 loss against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Burnley 0 – 1 Swansea City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36994442|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 August 2016|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> His first Burnley goal came in a 3-2 win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 5 November 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Burnley 3–2 Crystal Palace: Late Ashley Barnes strike puts Clarets ninth|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/burnley-vs-c-palace/356437|publisher=Sky Sports|date=5 November 2016|accessdate=7 January 2017}}</ref>
==International career== Jóhann played his first [[Iceland national under-21 football team|U21]] match for [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]] on 12 June 2008.<ref>{{cite news|title=Byrjunarlið U21 gegn Noregi klárt|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2008/06/12/byrjunarlid_u21_gegn_noregi_klart/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=12 June 2008|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Then on 12 August 2008, Jóhann was called up the national team for the first time.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jóhann Berg og Hólmar í landsliðinu|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2008/08/12/johann_berg_og_holmar_i_landslidinu/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=12 August 2008|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref> Jóhann won his first cap for Iceland in a friendly match against [[Azerbaijan national football team|Azerbaijan]], where he set up a goal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ísland gerði jafntefli við Aserbaídsjan|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/fotbolti/2008/08/20/island_gerdi_jafntefli_vid_aserbaidsjan/|publisher=mbl.is|language=Icelandic|date=20 August 2008|accessdate=19 September 2016}}</ref>
On 6 September 2013 Jóhann scored a hat-trick, the first person to do so for Iceland in 13 years, in a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|FIFA World Cup qualifying]] match against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]], equalizing with the last goal of the match, a left-footed, curling shot from the edge of the 18-yard box in the 91st minute, with the match finishing 4–4.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mbl.is/sport/efstadeild/2013/09/06/johann_bjargadi_stigi_med_thrennu/ |title=Jóhann Berg bjargaði stigi með glæsilegri þrennu |website=Mbl.is |date=6 September 2013 |accessdate=19 July 2016}}</ref>
He was selected for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] squad for Iceland<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ksi.is/landslid/nr/13334 |title=A karla – Lokahópur fyrir EM 2016 |date=9 May 2016 |accessdate=10 May 2016 |language=Icelandic |publisher=Knattspyrnusamband Íslands |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160512081400/http://www.ksi.is/landslid/nr/13334 |archivedate=12 May 2016 |df= }}</ref> and played his first UEFA Euro 2016 match, where he set up a goal for [[Birkir Bjarnason]]. This was the country's first ever goal in a major tournament when Birkir scored the equalizer against Portugal in [[UEFA Euro 2016 Group F#Portugal vs Iceland|their first group match]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jun/14/portugal-iceland-euro-2016-match-report|title=Match Report: Portugal 1 Iceland 1|date=14 June 2016|work=The Guardian|accessdate=15 June 2016}}</ref> On 27 June 2016, Jóhann played against [[England national football team|England]] in the [[UEFA Euro 2016]] round of 16 at the [[Allianz Riviera|Stade de Nice]], as Iceland upset England with a 2–1 victory to advance to the quarter-finals.<ref>{{cite news |title=England 1 Iceland 2: Fairytale continues as Hodgson's men crash out |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/england-1-iceland-2-fairytale-continues-hodgsons-men-crash-out |website=[[FourFourTwo]] |date=27 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}}</ref>
Jóhann went on to start every match for Iceland until they were eliminated from the tournament against [[France national football team|France]] in the [[UEFA Euro 2016 knockout phase#France vs Iceland|quarter-final]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Fletcher|first1=Paul|title=France 5–2 Iceland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36632457|accessdate=7 January 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 July 2016}}</ref>
In May 2018, he was named in Iceland's 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-cup/0/iceland-world-cup-2018-squad-list-team-guide/|title=Iceland World Cup 2018 squad list and team guide|date=22 June 2018|accessdate=24 July 2018}}</ref>
